msContents.summary: Chāndogya upaniṣad, a text belongs to the Chāndogya brāhmaṇa of the Sāmaveda. One Sanskrit verse in Granth scrip is written on the 61v. (61v 1)dadāti pratigṛṇāti kāryyamākhyāti pṛcchati pra? hi sajajano prabhūte tacca sarvaṃ (2) ? di sthitam

msItem.title: chandogya
msItem.explicit: ([61r 8]) ni nirate ya upaniṣatsu dharmmāste mayi santu te mayi santu .. 2103 ..

support.p: Broken cover of thick Palm leaf. Both guard folios are supported by inserting a thin palm leaf to cover the damage.

extent.measure: 2 guard folio, 2 blank folio and 61 numbered folios.

supportDesc.foliation: Granth numerals in the left margin. Last two folios are not numbered.
supportDesc.condition: Beginning of the text is lost due to cracked folio. Many folios are craked at the corners.

handNote.desc: Neatly written. m is written mostly for the anusvāra at the end. Sometimes the anusvāra after the syllable is found.

binding.p: Guard folios are broken. thin Palm leaves are used to cover the damage and support the guard folio. First guard folio is supported by inserting two thin palm leaves in the thick guard cover for support.

encodingDesc.p: folio number for the last folio is supplied. Occasionally spaces are added to seperate vesres. Syllables which are unreadable but can be guessed are added in the square brackets. Dots are used to show the gap of the syllables due to broken folio. Daṇḍa is used to mark the end of the verse or prose. Last folio number is supplied as the folio is not numbered.
